result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on February 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:43 AM Defendant Michael T Muns in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Defense and State requests an arraignment.
The Court will adjourn.
Judge's staff approved appearances by Zoom.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A/witness A/Town Bank in City of Delafield listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  The Defendant not to participate in any fiduciary duties. The Defendant not to act as a power attorney, trustee, or guardianship.   Defendant not to use or possess any personal identifying information other than their own, including financial transaction cards.

08:36 AM Defendant Michael T Muns in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Attorney Michael Winter
